intro: Antidesma comoense, commonly known as the African star fruit or wild star fruit, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are typically eaten raw or used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in home gardens in tropical regions.
